alert.note: Alert for Northeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 09 at 4:05PM AKST until January 10 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AKST MONDAY THROUGH THOMPSON PASS... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches. Winds gusting as high as 80 mph. * WHERE...Thompson Pass. * WHEN...Through 9 AM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...Plan on hazardous driving conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility to one quarter mile or less at times. Dangerously cold wind chills as low as 30 below zero overnight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The strongest winds are likely this afternoon and evening and will slowly diminish through Monday morning. They will however remain strong enough to cause severe visibility restrictions.
info.instruction: A Blizzard Warning means severe winter weather conditions are expected or occurring. Falling and blowing snow with strong winds and poor visibilities are likely. This will lead to whiteout conditions, making travel very hazardous. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you.If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
